unnormalised: The Govt. of India is urging citizens to link their Aadhaar no. with their Voter ID before the deadline of 31/12/2024. This initiative, spearheaded by the Election Commission of India (ECI), aims to create a more transparent and verifiable electoral roll. Officials say this process will help weed out duplicate entries and ensure a cleaner database.
normalised: The Government of India is urging citizens to link their Aadhaar number with their Voter I-D before the deadline of thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. This initiative, spearheaded by the Election Commission of India (E-C-I), aims to create a more transparent and verifiable electoral roll. Officials say this process will help weed out duplicate entries and ensure a cleaner database.

unnormalised: Sources inside the ECI mentioned that the move could potentially impact over 90 crore voters across the country. Linking Aadhaar, a 12-digit unique identifier, with the Electoral Photo Identity Card (EPIC) or Voter ID, is expected to reduce instances of voter fraud and multiple registrations under different names/addresses.
normalised: Sources inside the E-C-I mentioned that the move could potentially impact over ninety crore voters across the country. Linking Aadhaar, a twelve-digit unique identifier, with the Electoral Photo Identity Card (E-P-I-C) or Voter I-D, is expected to reduce instances of voter fraud and multiple registrations under different names or addresses.

unnormalised: While the process is voluntary as of now, many believe it could become mandatory in the future. The Election Commission has set up various channels to facilitate this linking process, including online portals, mobile apps, and designated centers. You can also text 'SEED <Voter ID> <Aadhaar Number>' to 166 or 51969 to link these.
normalised: While the process is voluntary as of now, many believe it could become mandatory in the future. You can also text 'S-E-E-D Voter I-D Aadhaar Number' to one six six or five one nine six nine to link these.

unnormalised: There have been some concerns raised about data privacy and potential misuse of information. However, the govt. assures that all data will be securely stored and used only for electoral purposes. For any issues, call 1950, the ECI's toll-free helpline between 10 AM to 5 PM on weekdays.

unnormalised: Citizens are advised to complete the linking process at the earliest to avoid any last-minute rush and to ensure their names are accurately reflected in the updated electoral rolls for the upcoming elections in 2025. For detailed instructions, visit the official ECI website or your nearest Voter Registration Center.
